Text:
If Jamie Dimon were serious about the problem of widening inequality, he’d use his lobbying prowess to help raise the minimum wage, make the refundable Child Tax Credit permanent, and raise taxes on the super-wealthy like himself. 

Not a chance.
https://t.co/cekhDk8c2Q

“Go out there. Speak up. Speak out. Get in the way. Get in good trouble, necessary trouble. And help redeem the soul of America.” 

Happy birthday, John Lewis. Let's end the filibuster and pass the John Lewis Voting Rights Act in his memory. https://t.co/gb9jOGpmFz

"The chain reaction of evil — hate begetting hate, wars producing more wars — must be broken, or we shall be plunged into the dark abyss of annihilation."

—Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.
How about we nix Presidents Day and make Election Day a national holiday instead?
https://t.co/BixmHX1Hq2.

Harold Hamm, one of the wealthiest oil execs in America, recently doled out an estimated $2.3 billion to each of his five children...completely tax-free. 

This is what oligarchy looks like.

Happy Presidents Day.

It’s a good day to contemplate whether Joe Biden has a prayer of keeping a Democratic House and Senate next year. Call me a hopeless optimist, but I think he does. 

Here are 10 reasons why:
https://t.co/1yWTDdONbZ

My Sunday Guardian column: Why has the White House decided to stop talking about the link between corporate power and inflation?

https://t.co/E33YclTpMQ

Just a casual reminder that Musk and Tesla have received billions in subsidies.

https://t.co/0MeGELflNE
Mark my words: if Russia invades Ukraine, the same Republicans in Congress who were silent when Trump cozied up to Putin will criticize Biden to no end.
Elon Musk’s antics epitomize the oligarch class: reckless, vapid, horrible to workers, motivated only by self-interest, but they are never held accountable for their behavior.
It is hard to overstate how damaging trickle-down economics has been for the American economy. It has eviscerated our tax code and empowered a class of oligarchs that dominate our political system.
Ok, let's hear your best captions. (Submit your caption at the link below by Monday 10am PT, 1pm ET for consideration.) https://t.co/2lH1ucQIom
I don’t know who needs to hear this, but the fact that corporations are raking in record profits should tell you every you need to know about inflation.

Do you see what I'm getting at here? Why does our consumer brain so often beat out our citizen brain?

The split brain, the rapid rise in CEO pay, and the investor's view — let's discuss.
https://t.co/1XUkrqjD27

4. Do you seek the lowest-priced goods and services (such as clothing and flights)?
(A) Yes, of course.
(B) No.

Ok, just a couple more:

3. Do you shop online for a lot of things?
(A) Yes.
(B) No.

2. How important is it to maintain steady jobs and good wages for American retail workers, manufacturing workers, and airline workers?
(A) Quite important.
(B) Not really important.

Some questions for your consideration (a thread):

1. How important is it to you to preserve neighborhoods with small shops and bookstores? 
(A) Quite important.
(B) Not really important.

The former president hauled off boxes of classified materials to his private estate, but we’re so used to his criminality that it’s hardly a blip in the news cycle. 

We must not become inured to these abuses of power. This is how democracy dies.

Nearly 4 million kids have been pushed into poverty since Manchin, Sinema, and the GOP let the expanded Child Tax Credit expire in December.

Poverty is a policy choice.
Why the White House has stopped telling the truth about inflation and corporate power by @RBReich https://t.co/nAAAi1yN7G

McDonald’s and Chipotle have increased their prices, blaming higher food and labor costs.

But McDonald’s revenues hit a five-year high in 2021 and Chipotle’s revenues increased by over 1/3 from two years before.

Why didn’t they absorb the cost increases? https://t.co/ke0h8H8mDR
The American people have a right to know that elected officials are acting on behalf of the public, not their own financial interests. Members of Congress must be banned from trading stocks.

Kim Potter, a white police officer, was just sentenced to less than two years for killing Daunte Wright.

This is the same system that sentenced Crystal Mason, a Black mother of three, to five years for voting when she didn't realize a past felony conviction made her ineligible.

PSA: If we make health care a right, employers who currently tie health care to employment could then use that spending to raise wages for their workers.

How exactly is that radical?

The first child tax credit payments lifted about 3M children *out* of poverty in July 2021.

But Manchin, Sinema, and the GOP care more about keeping the billionaire cash flowing than ensuring America’s children have food in their bellies.

I don’t know how they sleep at night.

Nearly four million kids have been pushed into poverty since Manchin, Sinema, and the GOP let the expanded Child Tax Credit expire in December 2021.

Poverty is a policy choice.
Will there ever be real accountability for the Jan. 6 insurrection? I don’t know. But here’s what I am sure about: If there isn’t accountability, the next coup will succeed.
Thanks to the great @SolanaRice for this @InequalityMedia collaboration.

For every $100 a white family holds, Black families hold just $5.04. 

Here's how America created its shameful racial wealth gap — and what we can do to fix it. https://t.co/edloWg73zw

Anyone else think Louis DeJoy needs to be fired before a crucial midterm election that depends on the reliability of mail-in voting?

Please join me in taking action today: https://t.co/MfpUssKM1z

Watch out for Hacksaw Bob — he's coming for the company and wants to trim the fat!
https://t.co/1XUkrqjD27

Dear employers: I can’t believe I even have to say this, but there is a reason your workers are quitting.

Raise wages. Increase benefits. Improve working conditions.  
See what happens.

How did the market for financial capital contribute to inequality?

Is there such a thing as “corporate social responsibility?”

We'll explore these questions and more in Class 2 of my Wealth and Poverty course, now available to the public:  https://t.co/1XUkrqjD27
There is no good reason elected officials should be able to trade individual stocks. Not one. Ban it. https://t.co/hmfnDhAZy2
Every worker deserves a union. Period.
Fun fact: 17 Nobel Prize-winning economists agree that Biden’s economic agenda would EASE inflation, not raise it. Know the truth.

Two months ago, baristas in Buffalo, NY formed the first-ever Starbucks union in the U.S.

Today, 98 Starbucks stores in 30 states have moved to unionize.

This is what a labor uprising looks like.
Thanks to @nowthisnews for the collaboration!
Here’s how the Fed’s decision to raise interest rates could shaft you: https://t.co/sUmwkO2TI1
Is there a shortage of labor? Or a shortage of jobs with dignity, fair pay, and basic benefits?

60% of Fox News’ vaccine coverage over the summer included anti-vax claims.

Meanwhile, 60% of Fox News viewers are in the high-risk group for the worst Covid outcomes.

Enough is enough. We're calling on cable companies to deplatform FOX. Add your name: https://t.co/KU6J3JhPXC
If the pandemic taught us anything, it’s that we need to decouple health insurance from employment. Losing a job shouldn’t mean the loss of a family’s lifeline to healthcare. https://t.co/uzEuaD7cH0

“The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame.”

— Oscar Wilde
https://t.co/aDkadG5bkZ

Biden is expected to ask Congress for another $770 billion+ for next year's Pentagon budget. That’s more than 4x the size of the Build Back Better bill. So where’s the reporting on the effects of this spending on the national debt, or on inflation, or whether it’s even necessary?

Systemic racism costs every American, whether white, Black or brown. Wealthy special interests who rig the rules want to keep us divided. Don’t let them.

Must-watch interview feat. @hmcghee: https://t.co/X8I07jWiZt

Myth: The left and right have gotten more extreme.

Truth: The left has barely moved. The right has moved far, far rightward. https://t.co/zEF9AjdEqY
Source: https://t.co/CujkCijEAi
Great news. Solidarity with @amazonlabor! https://t.co/6zugbv1bxI
Who’s a young person who has inspired you lately? Let me know in the comments.

This January, the amount of petitions for union elections was more than double the amount filed in January 2021 — and young people are leading the way.

Solidarity with every young organizer fighting back against corporate greed and exploitation. https://t.co/arsREW9C1l

Starbucks is raising prices after reporting a 31% increase in profits. The company’s revenue increased by almost 20% to over $8,000,000,000. Their CEO’s pay increased by almost 40% last year to more than $20,000,000.

Do not be fooled. This is about corporate greed. It always is.

Black workers make up 20% of factory assemblers at Tesla’s Fremont factory.

Yet just 3% of professionals at the plant are Black.

How many Black executives? Zero.

Does this sound like a company that cares about diversity?

For today's Office Hours, I want to know: What does today's extreme polarization mean for the future of American politics?

I'll chime in at the link below at 10am PT/1pm ET.
https://t.co/MC1RrfIy4y

People claim that we can't afford to tackle the climate crisis.

But if we allow the planet to warm by just 3.7°C, it’s estimated to do $551 trillion in damage—more than all the wealth that exists *in the world.*

What we really can't afford is to sit on our hands and do nothing.
I don’t know who needs to hear this, but trickle-down economics is just a scam that funnels your hard-earned cash to the ultra-rich. https://t.co/PRx9vnHSwC

PSA: If employers want additional workers, they can do what they do for anything they want more of but can’t obtain at its current price:

Pay more.
Why has America chosen to dramatically reduce poverty among the nation’s elderly but not among our children? The poverty rate for children under 5 years old is over 16%. That is a moral outrage.

California's racial discrimination lawsuit against Tesla is a good time to remind you that Musk illegally threatened to take away stock options if employees unionized, and has had 43 workers' rights violations filed against his company since 2010.
In the last 50 years, I’ve moved further to the left of center without changing my political views at all. How? The right has moved dangerously close to fascism. https://t.co/ynPOhAmnA3

If you had any worries about where the next generation is taking America, I urge you to look no further than @SBWorkersUnited. I continue to be inspired by the young Starbucks baristas who are leading the charge to unionize the company. https://t.co/o6QA7ogonl
https://t.co/QvLIBzfeZJ

Oligarchs support racist nationalism because it divides people & diverts attention from how much wealth the super-rich have accumulated. Racist nationalists support oligarchs because they provide near-limitless funding. It’s a dangerous relationship that's flying under the radar.

Google permanently banned Fox News host Dan Bongino for spreading Covid misinformation. Twitter permanently deplatformed Trump. DirecTV is dropping OAN.

Comcast, Charter, AT&T, and every other cable company can drop Fox, too.

We can win this.

New polling shows Fox News has nearly as much trust from its viewers for Covid-19 information as NPR, making the potential impact on public health devastating everywhere Fox News is on the air.

Join the call to deplatform Fox: https://t.co/KU6J3JhPXC
If you're against gun reform, you're not pro-life.
Source via @AMarch4OurLives: https://t.co/vssntTdbqn

Since Biden’s inauguration, there have been 47,734 gun deaths, and 718 mass shootings.

End the filibuster. Pass gun control. Now.
Why doesn't the media talk about the real inflationary impact of military spending? Or corporate subsidies? Or tax cuts for the rich? It's almost as if it's not about inflation at all...
https://t.co/DIsV6fI4RD

The wealth of the world’s 10 richest men doubled during the pandemic. 

If that doesn’t convince you wealth inequality is out of control, I don’t know what will.
If only Republicans cared as much about preventing widespread gun violence as they did about preventing young people from learning the truth about America.

Roses are red
Violets are blue
Nurses and health care workers deserve a raise
And you do, too

Why is America immobilized in the face of climate change, inequality, systemic racism, and attacks on democracy?

Because the gains from our political-economic system have gone to the top, while almost everyone else is working harder and getting nowhere.
https://t.co/2uTe4j8Z2e

My Sunday Guardian column: Beware the deadly mix of oligarchic economics and racist nationalist populism. 

If not checked, it will undermine democracy in the US and elsewhere.

If you are in need of some hope and inspiration in these dark days, just look to the baristas organizing across the country to deliver better wages and benefits at Starbucks.

"...Young people [are] recognizing that there is power in our collective, and that we all deserve to have a dignified, safe environment to work." -@IlhanMN 

These young @SBWorkersUnited activists give me such hope.

There's no telling what today’s youth can and will accomplish. https://t.co/oOuMAkyaRz

Billionaires are not the answer. 

https://t.co/DJXlN2ANBW

My advice to Marty Walsh, from one labor secretary to another: Stay away from baseball.

I wouldn’t touch another baseball labor dispute if Babe Ruth asked me in person. Here's why: https://t.co/S4WSQXeeXC

Why expand the Supreme Court?

Since 1969, Democratic presidents have appointed 4 Supreme Court justices, and Republicans have appointed 16 (5 of them by presidents who initially lost the popular vote).

We're not trying to pack the court. We’re trying to unpack it.
So they’re “essential workers” during the worst of the pandemic, but “low-skilled workers” when they ask for a raise? Am I getting that right?

After the first two Starbucks stores unionized in December, something unbelievable has happened: 78 Starbucks stores in 23 states have filed for union elections. It’s spreading like wildfire.

I sat down with the @SBWorkersUnited baristas who started it all. https://t.co/vuDukz4Ecp

Tell me our system is rigged without telling me our system is rigged.

I’ll start: 

Billionaire wealth has risen more since Covid began than it has in the last 14 years.

Choice A is the actual distribution of wealth.

Okay, well, these data are a bit old and it's even more skewed in favor of the top 20% now.
  
(Source: https://t.co/bUK7bWMKQP) https://t.co/epnmEmryqM
Choice C is what Americans would like the distribution of wealth to be. https://t.co/vaCTH3MMhz
Amazon avoided about $5,200,000,000 in corporate federal income taxes in 2021. The real freeloaders in this country are corporations, not the poor.
Choice B is what Americans think the distribution of wealth is. https://t.co/IWlEeEKJi8

Pop quiz: What is the accurate distribution of wealth in the United States?

(Okay, you won't be graded, but if you want to learn more, you can check out the first session of my big undergraduate course "Wealth & Poverty" here: https://t.co/W0MN0OhbMP ) https://t.co/jSjZu46xi7

Why did inequalities of income and wealth begin to widen so dramatically in the late 1970s and early 1980s, and continue widening since?

We'll start to explore that very question in Class 1 of my Wealth and Poverty course, now available to the public: https://t.co/W0MN0OhbMP

ICYMI: The Supreme Court restored Alabama's congressional map that creates only *one* district favorable to a Black candidate.

The full case won’t be heard until next term, so the gerrymandered map will stay for the midterm elections — unless Democrats act. The clock is ticking.
Know the truth. https://t.co/JxpSFv6wlR

The right wants to blame inflation on Biden.

Do you know what they never want to talk about?

The deeper structural driver of inflation:

The concentration of the American economy in the hands of a few corporate giants with the power to raise prices.
